article.headline: William &amp, Mary 71, Fairfield 50
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Danny Sumner scored 13 points to lead William and Mary to a 71-50 victory over Fairfield on Monday. Three-point baskets by both teams dominated the start of the first half, as the Tribe scored its first 15 points off the long-range jumper. Nine of the Stags' first 15 points came on 3-pointers. The lead changed hands three times before Sumner hit a pair of free throws with 8:45 left in the first half to put William and Mary (4-7) ahead for good. The Tribe broke open a close game with an 18-7 run over four and a half minutes in the second half, taking a 54-38 lead with 12:16 left. Chris Darnell and Nathan Mann each added 12 points for the Tribe. Greg Nero led Fairfield (3-9) with 12 points and six rebounds, and Jonathan Han added 11 points. Fairfield outrebounded William and Mary 39-36, but came up short in shooting, hitting just 28 percent of its field goal attempts to William and Mary's 46 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
